page.title: 11HOME LIFE
page.content: I live in Bethersden but go to school in Tenterden because my dad thinks it's a better place to go. I am woken up at about 8 o'clock but most mornings I don't feel too great about getting up (most people don't so I bet you know how I feel).Breakfast time and I have crunchy nut cornflakes, a cup of tea and some apple juice. Then dad takes me to school in our car. I can't tell you much about the drive to school because I'm normally half asleep and don't notice that much. Then it's into school as cheerful as usual.After registration it's time for assembly where we pray and sing hymns. Mr. Weaver sings his heart out and I try to sing over his loud voice which is hard.Then it's back to our classroom to "good old Mr. Whitcombe" with some lovely gems of work for us to do. {(continued)
